Text.Value: You seem to be a little on edge - are you all right?
Actually, it looks like your caravan crew are eager to help out - I think I'll leave it to them.
This was your fault, I know it! The guards will hear about this, make no mistake!
I've got nothing to say to them.
Arfur, sweetheart - you paid me and my boys to be caravan guards, not cattle wranglers.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cocky and a little patronising; she has no fear of this man and knows she's in the right

Text.Value: Come on, boys - let's take out the trash.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: He's not actually paying here, it is assumed he will pay later, but he has the gold.
EditorData.NodeContext: A little too pleased it's come to violence

Text.Value: Who do you think you are? Zenovia, people are lining up to break into my property - do something about it!

EditorData.NodeContext: Incredulous/indignant (and anxious in case they discover the secret stuff in his basement)

Text.Value: Mind if I take a look?
Look, time is money - and I'm losing both just standing here. Make your call, judge, before Zenovia makes it for you.
Ugh, this is the last time I hire someone from the Guild.
What do you want? I have filthy squatters decreasing the value of my property as we speak!

EditorData.NodeContext: Frustrated; annoyed at the player's interruption

Text.Value: You want... me... to... um, hah. Buggery.

EditorData.NodeContext: nervous, being forced into a difficult, compromising position by a terrfiying barbarian

Text.Value: It's one thing to donate - extremely generously - to those less fortunate than oneself, and quite another to give away one's entire house!
We did our job, Arfur. Looks like your eyes were bigger than your purse.
You want the Flaming Fist poking around my business - my property? Gods...
I really just quite enjoy brutalising the poor.
Have you tried talking it out with them? Perhaps you could come to some sort of agreement.
I suppose you're right. Come on, boys - let's beat that magic out of 'em.
How about you live and let live and I let you live in return?
You're right, it's not - I'll leave you to it.
You left, they took it - it's not yours. Unless you kill them in single combat, of course.
Think you can do it? Fine. Be my guest.
Gesture at Gregorio - invite him to reply.
It's worse than I thought - witchcraft.
Want to make yourself useful? Do something about these vermin running amok in my ancestral home!
I could help you get rid of them if you like.
Let them stay, a nearby church may give you coin for the trouble. Charity can pay.
You paid us to protect you and your high-quality merchandise on the road - and we've since arrived at our destination.
I can't let them stay here - what if the little brat gets into the basement?
Relax. You don't need all this space, these people do. Everyone wins.
Shhh, sweetheart - adults are talking. This is Guild business and we'll handle it - as soon as we get paid.

EditorData.NodeContext: Patronising - but firm on the final words follow the - (she's showing Arfur she means business)

Text.Value: It gets cold out there at night, Mister Gregorio, my kids will get sick. Please, we'll stay out of your way, we just need a roof.
You'll pay for this, you meddling reject!
This 'home' already steals so much land from nature - surely you can share it.
This is a pretty big house - are you sure you don't have a single spare room?
Well, good luck with that.
They stay, or I will burn this building until there is not a board left standing.
Get those criminals out of my house and you'll have my profound gratitude.
I can make these squatters disappear for half as much as this lot are asking.
This is quite a pitiful estate to be fighting over.
I'm a very magnanimous individual, but this is my home. Either they leave, or I'll make them.
Fine, fine - they can stay. Just don't blame me when they turn on you like the mongrels they are!

EditorData.NodeContext: Panicked by the threat but still trying to stick to his story before fleeing

Text.Value: Calm down and tell me what's going on.
They stay - and I will smite you down should you try and remove them.
The property won't have much value if I turn it to ash. Let them stay.
Let them stay or I'll decrease the value of your property by mounting your head above the door.
A vigilante, eh? But you definitely have your head screwed on straight - a rarity these days.
What? No - don't be ridiculous!
*This man's indignant demeanour barely masks a seething anxiety. There's more to this situation than he's letting on.*
Delve into this frustrated man's mind.
I can always ask the Flaming Fist to mediate - they love a wartime property requisition.
Not now, sweetheart.
I'm merely a concerned bystander. That man standing in front of your house, however...
I could help you out with that if you want.
My gold - it's gone! Zenovia, how could you let this happen?!
My point exactly!
The clergy? Poking around my business - my home?
Zenovia, get this evil creature and his coven out of my house before he tries to curse me again!

EditorData.NodeContext: Still outraged but pretty pleased with himself for having protection

Text.Value: Oh gods no. No, no, no. I won't be having the clergy poking their noses around my home.
In that case, perhaps I can help you out.
You shouldn't have to make people feel welcome in places they don't belong.

EditorData.NodeContext: Pointed (aimed at the refugees but maybe a little at the player too)

Text.Value: Well, wouldn't you be on edge if your beautiful home had been defiled by such brazen interlopers?

EditorData.NodeContext: Definitely showing his nervousness; worried the player might know his secret

Text.Value: I have absolutely no idea what you're talking about. But that does rather sound like a threat...

EditorData.NodeContext: Incredulous (but definitely lying/does know what the player is talking about)

Text.Value: I never said anyone needed to get hurt - as long as they get out as soon as possible.
Wait! Please!
I'll get them out of your house for free.
If it comes down to such barbaric measures... Well, that's what I hired Zenovia here for.
Raise an eyebrow at Ben, is that all he has?
No, no - it's fine. I'd rather these mongrels stay, if that's the choice.

EditorData.NodeContext: nervous but resolved, this is the least bad option

Text.Value: But other than that, I don't care what methods you use. As long as you get rid of them - and fast - it's fine by me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Frustrated; just wants to get this done

Text.Value: Squatters, is it? Maybe I'd be willing to lend a helping hand.
Do you think me a fool? Zenovia, that was an attempted assault on my person - time to do what I paid you for.

EditorData.NodeContext: Still outraged but pretty pleased with himself for having protection

Text.Value: Zenovia and I are just navigating a slight contractual disagreement - not that it's any of your concern.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to hold it together through growing anger/frustration

Text.Value: I hear these sorts of houses always have basements - what do you use yours for?
The gods study our deeds during crises - now is a bad time to be uncharitable.
It's always heartening to see a true philanthropist out in the wild.
If you can't share, I will tear this house down and reclaim the land for nature.
Pft, they're like kobolds - you let one in and soon the place will be crawling with them!
What d'you mean by that?

EditorData.NodeContext: Wary; doesn't want someone else involved

Text.Value: Look, I have some very valuable components in there - I need to get that lot out before they damage something.

EditorData.NodeContext: Anxious/insistent that he needs the refugees to leave

Text.Value: Just a little magic trick - nothing malevolent about it, I assure you.
I guess we're all you've got, then, Arfur. Want your house squeaky clean? Cough up.
I cannot make the call. Decide amongst yourselves.
If you want us to get our hands dirty, it'd be our pleasure - but that'll be extra.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sweetly matter of fact - but suddenly hard on "but that'll be extra"

Text.Value: Let them stay or I'll make you leave and never come back.
Are you threatening me?
My reasons are my own. Do you want to save some money or not?
Come on, boys - let's go home.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little weary by this point

Text.Value: The army of the Absolute is mere days away and you're bickering over property ownership?
None of this would have happened if you had a butler manning the house.
Enough of this bickering! You - what's your proposal?

EditorData.NodeContext: Snapping; wants to know what's what

Text.Value: Leave.
The refugees must go. I'll remove them, if you so desire.
I respect your candour, but I really don't want to upset my good friend Zenovia - or her lovely Rats.
Not if they're trying to help themselves to other people's property!
I've been in your basement - I know what you've been up to.
Now please show this meddler some of that famous Rivington hospitality.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: He's not actually paying here, it is assumed he will pay later, but he has the gold.

Text.Value: Zenovia, get these squatters out of my house now.

EditorData.NodeContext: Indignant at the situation and frustrated at the lack of action from Zenovia and company

Text.Value: Attack.
Excuse me? I'm exceedingly charitable - ask anyone in this wretched town!
You're the rightful owner and they're trespassing. I want to see justice done.
The house seems big enough to share. Should be quite simple.
Well, I'm... That's all very sad, b-but I still don't see how -
Everyone calm. Explain your disagreement, and we shall find an accord.
As I said - anything else is extra.
*This man is definitely lying - and he's really hoping you don't pry any further.*
This house looks huge - are you sure you don't have any spare rooms?
Handling this myself is the only way I can guarantee there won't be any blood spilled.
Fine - but you make them leave. No thugs. No coward shit. OR ELSE.
Look, we needed somewhere to live. This place was empty, and it had walls. I've got children, for Tyr's sake.
You! You cast some kind of fell magic on me!
Does no one we meet ever get along?
This is my home! I may pride myself on my philanthropy, but I draw the line at being a halfway house.

EditorData.NodeContext: Frustrated/a little panicky; he is low on resources and this house is key

Text.Value: Fine - here's the extra. Finish. The job.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Reaches behind back to retrieve coin purse from inventory.

Text.Value: You don't exactly look desperate for gold, but I can't help but admire such solid business acumen.
Mister Gregorio's right - your presence here is unlawful. It's his choice if you stay.
Ye gods, this guy is begging to get smacked.

EditorData.NodeContext: Shitty landlord with a highly punchable demeanour. But Karlach is saying this a bit to herself/ the team, trying not to make the situation worse.

Text.Value: Very well - get the job done and you'll be paid and be in my good graces.
I just want to remove these unlawful interlopers from my property!
But if you happened to take things into your own hands first, well - I couldn't stop you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Definitely saying this on the down low

Text.Value: I could just burn down the entire place. Then no one gets the house.
Zenovia - why are you just standing there? Do what I'm paying you for!
Look, I know the Guild's rates - I'll solve your problem for half the cost.
Old family motto: never trust anyone who works for free. What's in it for you?

EditorData.NodeContext: Suspicious of the player's intentions (but proud of the motto)

Text.Value: Well, I tried. I have more important things to take care of than squatting squabbles.
You didn't hire us to piss about with spellcasters - that'll definitely cost you double.
My basement? Oh, nothing interesting! Just materials - I'm a craftsman, you see.

EditorData.NodeContext: Nervous; definitely doesn't want the player to look in his basement so is trying to brush it off

Text.Value: Agreement? Why should I negotiate with the vermin who've stolen my house?!
I don't see why I should be explaining myself. It's my property. They are on it - unlawfully.
You certainly know how to make people feel welcome.
The place was empty! Keep those thugs away from my family!

Synopsis:
The player happens upon a conflict between merchant Arfur Gregorio and the gang he employed (Zenovia Dawg and the Rivington Rats) as he tries to persuade them to get rid of a family of refugees who took up residence in his house while he was away. The player can side with the merchant or the refugees and get paid for the trouble (as well as annoying Zenovia by meddling in Guild affairs).

The scene according to the overview doc:
Refugee Ben Golewits stands in the doorway of the house, looking pugnacious, while the rest of the Golewits family cluster anxiously behind him. Outside, merchant Arfur Gregorio is bickering with Zenovia Dawg about getting the Rivington Rats to clear the refugees out of his house. Nearby, several refugees watch the scene nervously, including the tiefling, Lakrissa, if she has survived.
